brief.brief: Every RAD application has its own command panel. The command panel uses the parameter form.

The parameter form defines the parameters passed to it by the calling application, the parameters it returns to the calling application, and the exits it may take upon the detection of various conditions.
A parameter form can have any number of fields.
The Application Encyclopedia only creates a form with the standard fields.

detail.detail: You can add additional fields using Forms Designer.
Do not add fields with the same names as the standard fields.
The input field names for the fields you add must exist in the application table.
See the Application table for a list of available fields and their types.
When defining the fields in Forms Designer, set the PARSE flag on (add 32768 to the value in the ctrl field), unless you do not want the field parsed. This would be unusual for a parameter form.
Application: The name of the application of which the panel is a part.
Label: Always contains "parameter" for parameter panel.
Comments: Describe the function this step performs.
Normal: The exit to take normally.
Error: The exit to take after an error.
